statement.p: Suppose A is an n \times n matrix. How many operations does solving Ax=b take (in the worst case scenario)?

Let A be an n \times n matrix. Which of the following are equivalent to the statement that A is invertible?
The reduced row echelon form of A is the identity matrix.
A is similar to the identity matrix.
A is diagonalizable.
There is a matrix B such that AB is the identity matrix.
0 is not an eigenvalue of A.

answer.p: 1, 4, and 5. The only matrix that is similar to the identity matrix is the identity matrix iself, and the zero matrix is diagonal(izable).
